meanings.def: one more time; on another occasion
examples: This must never happen again.
Try again—it takes practice.
Can we start again, please?
Could you say it again, please?
When will I see you again?
Rowling again proves to be a superb storyteller.
I've told you again and again (= many times) not to do that.
I'll have to write it all over again (= again from the beginning).
She tried over and over again (= many times) to get it right.
He has yet again (= as has happened many times before) shown that he cannot be trusted.
Once again (= as had happened several times before), the train was late.

meanings.def: showing that somebody/something is in the same place or state that they were in originally
examples: We're very happy to be here together again.
He was glad to be home again.
You'll soon feel well again.
She spends two hours a day getting to work and back again.

meanings.def: added to an amount that is already there
examples: The cost is about half as much again as it was two years ago.
I'd like the same again (= the same amount or the same thing).

meanings.def: used to show that a comment or fact is connected with what you have just said
examples: And again, we must think of the cost.

meanings.def: used to introduce a fact or an opinion that contrasts with what you have just said
examples: We might buy it but then again we might not.

meanings.def: used when you ask somebody to tell you something or repeat something that you think they have told you already
examples: What was the name again?
Every now and again she checked to see if he was still asleep.

meanings.def: used to ask somebody to serve you the same drink as before
examples: Same again, please!

meanings.def: often; on many or all occasions
examples: You will get a perfect result time after time if you follow these instructions.
Time and again, the girls have shown how strong and determined they can be.
Every now and again she checked to see if he was still asleep.

idioms.def: used to ask somebody to serve you the same drink as before
examples: Same again, please!

idioms.idiom: time after time | time and (time) again
idioms.def: often; on many or all occasions
examples: You will get a perfect result time after time if you follow these instructions.
Time and again, the girls have shown how strong and determined they can be.

related: half as many, much, etc. again
